etymology.description: 八(八) (bā, "speech; breath") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 人(人) (rén, "person") -> original character for 'to speak' (說) or 'pleased' (悅)

examples.chinese: 我今天去银行兌外币(我今天去銀行兑外幣)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jīntiān qù yínháng duì wàibì.
examples.english: I am going to the bank today to exchange foreign currency.

examples.chinese: 我们先检查票据(我們先檢查票據)，然后兌成现金买东西(然後兑成現金買東西)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xiān jiǎnchá piàojù, ránhòu duì chéng xiànjīn mǎi dōngxī.
examples.english: We first check the receipts, then exchange them for cash to buy things.
